title: THE AUTHORITY OF THE BELIEVER
subtitle: UNDERSTANDING THE BELIEVER'S AUTHORITY
memory_verse: Then Jesus came to them and said, “All authority in heaven and on earth has been given to me.” - Matt. 28:18
objective: To examine the authority to be enjoyed by a Child of God
INTRODUCTION: Authority connotes the power to rule. Jesus Christ has been endowed with all powers that nothing can stand against which has literally been transferred to everyone that believes in Him. Every believer is therefore, expected to exercise the authority in Christ Jesus.
CONCLUSION: The authority we enjoy in Christ Jesus knows no bound as long as we remain steadfast and rooted in Him.

title: THE AUTHORITY OF THE BELIEVER
subtitle: SOURCE OF BELIEVER'S AUTHORITY
memory_verse: “I am the vine, ye are the branches: He that abideth in me, and I in him, the same bringeth forth much fruit: for without me ye can do nothing.” - John 15:5
objective: To reiterate Christ, the only source of our authority
INTRODUCTION: The growth and success of a believer is hinged on the understanding of the authority one has in Christ Jesus, continuous connection to the source is key, any disconnection from it will hinder us from manifesting our authority in Christ Jesus
Discussion_title: The believers stay connected to the source through
CONCLUSION: It is the desire of God that as He has endowed us with authority from above, we walk circumspectly in that reality according to His Word

title: THE AUTHORITY OF THE BELIEVER
subtitle: BELIEVER'S AUTHORITY MADE MANIFEST
memory_verse: “IThe Spirit of the Lord is upon me, because he hath anointed me to preach the gospel to the poor; he hath sent me to heal the brokenhearted, to preach deliverance to the captives, and recovering of sight to the blind, to set at liberty them that are bruised” - Luke 4:18
objective: OBJECTIVE: To examine what authority is in Christ Jesus
INTRODUCTION: As believers we are to live with the assurance and certainty of the authority we have both in- and through- our Lord, Jesus. Our authority is made manifest because we have been translated from the kingdom of darkness into the kingdom of his dear son. (Col 1:13)
Discussion_title: Our authority is made manifest through
CONCLUSION: A believer in Christ need not to be fearful, all authority has been given to our Lord Jesus Christ. As a believer in Christ, operating from this place of authority is of utmost importance for our everyday living.

title: THE AUTHORITY OF THE BELIEVER
subtitle: EXERCISING AUTHORITY AS A BELIEVER
memory_verse: “But to as many as did receive and welcome Him, He gave the authority to become the children of God that is, to those who believe in His name.” -John 1:12 (Amp)
objective: To highlight the practical aspects of exercising our God-given authority as believers.
INTRODUCTION: The spiritual authority of a believer is the right given to the believer to exercise (or to make use of) the indwelling power of God. We become a big threat to the devil when we know how powerful we are and acknowledge the authority we have in Christ Jesus
Discussion_title: How to exercise authority as believers

DISCUSSION.title: Interceding and standing in gap for others
Halt the work of the enemy

CONCLUSION: Walking in spiritual authority is knowing who we are in Christ and operating in that consciousness.

subtitle: MAINTAINING YOUR AUTHORITY AS A BELIEVER
memory_verse: “If you remain in me and my words remain in you, ask whatever you wish and it will be done - John 15:7
objective: To identify what is required to maintain our authority as believer
INTRODUCTION: Removing a species from its natural habitat can either lead to the death of the species or a stunted and non-profitable growth. For a species to perform to its full productivity, it is expected to be in a favourable habitat with all the essential resources for its growth and nourishment
